act.title: the Indian Tolls (Army ANd Air Force) Rules, 1942

article.section: 1 These rules may be called the Indian Tolls (Army and Air Force) Rules, 1942.
2 They extend to the whole of India.

act.article: 2 Save as hereinafter otherwise provided in Rule 3, where exemption from the payment of tolls is claimed under the Indian Tolls (Army and Air Force) Act, 1901 (II of 1901), in respect of any person or body of persons or any property, a pass, in the Form annexed, shall be presented on the demand of the person authorized to demand the tolls.

article.section:
2 No passes shall be required in the case of officers of the Regular Forces, the Territorial Army, the National Cadet Corps or of any Irregular Corps or of any Armed Forces maintained by Part B States, when travelling on duty, though not in uniform:
Provided that the officer so travelling shall furnish in writing to the person authorized to demand toll his name, rank and a statement that he is travelling on duty.

act.article: 4 Every pass shall be signed by the Commanding Officer of the regiment, corps, unit, or detachment concerned, or by a station staff officer.
